setting.description: Location of the LocalDB directory. If the specified path is relative, the path will be considered relative to the servlet's WEB-INF directory.

setting.label: LocalDB Implementation Class
setting.description:
Java class implementation used by LocalDB. Default is the embedded BerkeleyDB Java Edition. Several default implementations are available.
Implementation ClassDescription
password.pwm.util.localdb.Berkeley_LocalDBDefault Implementation based on BerekelyDB Java Edition
password.pwm.util.localdb.Derby_LocalDBBased on Apache Derby java embedded SQL database
password.pwm.util.localdb.JDBM_LocalDBUses JDBM2 as the embedded key store
password.pwm.util.localdb.Memory_LocalDBIn-Memory implementation, Super fast but not persistent and you will need a lot of memory

setting.label: LocalDB Initialization String
setting.description: Value passed to the LocalDB Implementation class during initialization. Value format is specific to the implementation.

setting.label: Database Class
setting.description: Database class name. The Java JDBC full driver class name. The corresponding JDBC drivar JAR or ZIP file must be included in the classpath, typically in the WEB-INF/lib directory or the application server's lib directory.

setting.label: Database Connection String
setting.description:
Database connection string in standard JDBC format.
Database TypeExample Connection String
MS-SQL jdbc:sqlserver://host.example.net:port;databaseName=SELFSERVICEDB
MS-SQL using jTDSjdbc:jtds:sqlserver://host.example.net:port/SELFSERVICEDB
MySQLjdbc:mysql://host.example.net:port/SELFSERVICEDB

setting.label: Database Username
setting.description: Database username

setting.label: Database Password
setting.description: Database password

setting.label: External Change Method
setting.description:
Java classes to call after a successful password change. These classes may take such actions as updating passwords in other systems or updating eDirectory. External password classes must implement the interface password.pwm.ExternalChangeMethod.

Unless your adding custom Java code to PWM, you should leave this blank.

setting.label: External Judge Method
setting.description: Java classes to call to determine the strength of a given password. External judge methods must implement the interface password.pwm.ExternalJudgeMethod. During password judge checks, all listed classes will be invoked. If multiple results are returned, the lowest returned value will be used as the result.

setting.label: External Rule Method
setting.description:
Java classes to call to determine any rule violations of a given password. External rule methods must implement the interface password.pwm.ExternalRuleMethod.

Unless your adding custom Java code, you should leave this blank.

setting.label: HTTP Proxy
setting.description:
The url of the HTTP proxy server. If blank, no proxy server will be used.
  • For http proxy server, use "http://serverame:3128" format
  • For authenticated proxy server, use the "http://username:password@servername:3128" format

setting.label: CAS ClearPass URL
setting.description:
For CAS authentication integration, enter the ClearPass url here. If blank, CAS authentication integration will be disabled.

You will also need to edit the WEB-INF/web.xml file to enable CAS integration. Uncomment the section for the CAS servlet filters, and modify the CAS servlet parameters as appropriate for your configuration.

setting.label: Enable URL Shortening Service Class
setting.description: URL Shortening Service class name. The Java full class name that implements a short url service. The corresponding JAR or ZIP file must be included in the classpath, typically in the WEB-INF/lib directory or the application server's lib directory.

setting.label: Regular Expression for Matching URLs
setting.description: Enter a regular expression to be used for matching URLs to be shortened by the URL Shortening Service Class

setting.label: Configuration Parameters for URL Shortening Service
setting.description: Name/Value settings used to configure the selected URL shortening service, like for example an API key, username, password or domain name. The settings must be in "name=value" format, where name is the key value of a valid service setting.

setting.label: Enable External Web Services
setting.description: Allow public use of web services. When false, the form nonce is required for all web services. The form nonce is difficult (though not impossible) for a client to retreive programmatically. Therefore it is difficult, though not impossible to use the web services. When true, the form nonce is not required to invoke the web services.

setting.label: Allow WebServices Read Answers
setting.description: Allow web services to be used to read stored challenge/response answers of users. The read responses will be available in whatever hashing method format is being used.

setting.label: External Web Auth Methods
setting.description: External Web Auth Methods

category.label: LDAP Directory
category.description: Settings that control the interaction with an LDAP directory

category.label: General
category.description: General settings for the application. Settings here control the functionality and behavior of the system.

category.label: User Interface
category.description: These settings control overall features and displays that are visible to the end user.

category.label: Password Policy
category.description: This password policy is applied to all users, regardless of any other password policy that may be configured in the directory. If so configured, The password policy configured for the user in the directory is read and is merges the policy with the global policy configured here. When policies are merged, the most restrictive setting is used.

category.label: Challenge Policy
category.description: Challenge Policy. If a challenge policy is read from the directory, that policy will override the settings listed here.

category.label: Email
category.description:
Configuration settings for all sent emails. For email body configuration, both plaintext and HTML settings are provided. It is encouraged that for each configured setting and locale, both plaintext and (if desired) HTML email bodies are configured. Email will be delivered in both formats and the email client can choose which to display.

The body (plaintext or HTML), subject and from values of emails may use Macros. See the "View" menu "Show Macro Help" for more information about Macros.

category.label: SMS
category.description: Configuration settings for all sent SMS messages. For SMS message text configuration settings are provided. It is encouraged that for each configured setting and locale, SMS texts are configured. Messages will be delivered using the configured short message service gateway.

category.label: Security
category.description:
This application has built in intruder detection independent of what a directory may provide. Because this application may be exposed directly to the internet, this additional layer of detection helps protect against direct attacks. The ldap directory's own internal intruder detection (if enabled) will always be honored as well. The goal for this intruder detection system isn't to watch for human intruders, it is designed to stop robot or automatic attacks.

Captcha functionality uses an implementation of reCAPTCHA to prevent non-human attacks. reCAPTCHA info can be found at http://www.google.com/recaptcha/

Registration at the reCAPTCHA site will provide a public and private key which must be configured here for reCAPTCHA support.

category.label: Tokens
category.description: Options for email and sms tokens sent to users.

category.label: Logging & Alerts
category.description: Alert and Logging settings.

category.label: Novell eDirectory
category.description: These settings are only used when Novell eDirectory is the ldap directory service being used.

category.label: Active Directory
category.description: Active Directory settings

category.label: Database
category.description:
Optional database configuration settings. Two types of databases are used.

LocalDB

The LocalDB is a local, embedded database that is used for storage of local data. In most cases, the LocalDB requires no administration or maintenance, and the defaults are sufficient.

RDBMS Database

If configured, a traditional RDBMS database can be used to store data for certain functions. Any standard RDBMS that supports a standard Java JDBC driver can work. Upon startup, a database connection will be made and any necessary tables and schema will be created. Multiple server instances can be configured for the same database instance.

category.label: Integration / Developer
category.description: Settings that are of interest to developers or component integrators.

category.label: Forgotten Password
category.description: Policies for user's forgotten password configuration.

category.label: Forgotten Username
category.description: Allow a user to search for a forgotten username using a configurable search filter and attributes.

category.label: New User Registration
category.description: Note: The new user registration module requires that the proxy user has sufficient permissions to create users and, if so configured, to check for duplicate values.

category.label: Guest Registration
category.description: Note: The guest user registration module requires that the logged in user has sufficient permissions to create users and, if so configured, to check for duplicate values.

category.label: User Activation
category.description: The user activation module allows users to activate an account they have not previously authenticated to. The user does not need to know the password to activate the account.

category.label: Update Profile
category.description: The update user profile module will force/allow the user to update the attributes configured here. This is useful for forcing the user to populate to update some piece of information.

category.label: Shortcut Menu
category.description: The shortcut menu is used to display a list of click-able links to users. This functionality may be useful as a basic landing page for users.

category.label: Helpdesk
category.description: Configurations for administrative helpdesk.
